Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great, non-tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Nicole E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice. Once in 2009 and this past January. We rented an apartment with a kitchen and large bedroom; their elaborate buffet breakfast was included. It is the perfect place to stay if you want to get to know the area and see lots of art, dine with the locals, and not feel like a tourist trapped in a mall. The area has developed some from 2009 into a more family area with more local bars, restaurants, and shops. We will stay here any time we come to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I hoped for, and more”
Reviews.Author: NachBerlin
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for just the right hotel for a recent Berlin visit during Christmas week. I wanted something cozy, with character and charm, where there would be a nice old-fashioned Christmas vibe. Also wanted a convenient location. The Honigmond was everything I hoped for and more. I knew from the moment I entered my room and saw a chocolate Santa on my pillow that I was in the right place! My room was very small but darling and comfortable (and I was really only there to sleep and shower), and the bathroom was recently done and lovely. My young-adult sons shared a room across the hall that was quite spacious. Rooms boast wood floors, high ceilings, chandeliers, ornate mirrors, and antique-look furniture; each room is unique. The front desk staff was welcoming and helpful, and the lobby, with its two (faux) fireplaces and comfy furniture, was a nice place to sit and grab a beer or glass of wine, available on an "honor system" (just sign the book to say what you've taken). We especially loved the adjoining restaurant. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was very typically German; the breads, rolls, and homemade jams were wonderful. We ate dinner there twice and the food was marvelous. Love the lit tapers on every table (even at breakfast). A very short walk to Nordbahnhof; hop on a train and get anywhere--or just walk to wherever you're going--nothing seemed too far. If you are looking for deluxe chain-hotel ambience and services, look elsewhere, but those places are a dime a dozen. The Honigmond is one of a kind. I hope to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephane75009
Reviews.Content: Great charming hotel in the center of Berlin. Beautiful rooms quite big with all comfort. It was actually much nicer than what we expected from the Website. Good bed. It misses simply a bit of attention from the people working there. Still we would come back as it is really a good choice (value for money for comfort and location).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: CollTom
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is fantastic! The rooms are small, but the showers are nice. By the way, the art is not original...

Reviews.Title: “A flavour of Old Berlin in a modern style”
Reviews.Author: TravelManGlasgow
Reviews.Content: If you want a non-chain hotel in a residential part of the city with nice staff, spacious rooms with high ceilings, and lots of character, this could be for you. Think old wooden floors, (but not too creaky), chandaliers, ornate wooden cornicing, dark wood and lots of 19th C (and before) art, you've got a bit of the flavour of this hotel. The hotel's origins date to 1920 but it was rebuilt after being destroyed in the war so it's not decrepit by any manner of means. Breakfasts are substantial enough but a bit on the plain side - not the best muesli I've seen, unappealing scrambled eggs in various forms, so-so sausages. However the bread and croissants were very good and the salmon was fresh, as were the boiled eggs. In the rooms, the bathroom is top-notch with quality shower, sink, lights and tiling. The mattress was very comfortable but the pillow was a large square one - yeuch. And the curtains could have done with being lined to block out at least some of the light. Overall, though, a hotel with real character in a nice district, five minutes walk from Nordbanhof.

Reviews.Title: “The times they are a- changin'”
Reviews.Author: TomSmits
Reviews.Content: We came back for the second time simply because the hotel is in a good location and the people were friendly back in '09. But that was 2009, the times they are a- changin'! Business must go very well for the Honigmond, 'cause they couldn't care less about their costumers in 2011. The lack of service in the restaurant made us check out early and look for an other hotel. Guest from the Honigmond hotel are not welcome in the Honigmond restaurant even though that's were breakfast-buffet is! They want you to leave a.s.a.p because during holidays locals like to visit this place too. By the way, the waitress was friendly at one time when she asked if we wanted a glass of water with our meal, later on we understood why, they had charged 4 euros(!) on the bill for two glasses of water.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with lovely atmosphere"”
Reviews.Author: flyhighstaylow
Reviews.Content: Very good location in the old eastern part of Berlin. Close by to Friedrichstrasse, museums, bars and restaurant area. Helpful staff and friendly attitude. The buffet breakfast was absolutely wonderful. ll kind of different coffe, fresh fruit, all kind of cheese, different types of bread and a nice breakfast/restaurant area. A must stay if you like spacious rooms in an old building and love to have a breakfast feast while travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at this price”
Reviews.Author: Brightontraveller-2
Reviews.Content: The Honigmond is an elegant and well-situated hotel with a good restaurant. The high prices give rise to high expectations and so the main issue I had is value for money. The room was elegant but small: decor a bit kitsch with gilt framed pictures. The bathroom was small with no frills e.g. the soap dispenser in the shower remained empty during the 2 days of our visit and the towels were inadequate. The location was in a quiet side-street.. However the weather was hot and sunny and with no A/C or blinds on the large windows this made the room so hot at night that sleeping became difficult. The inclusive buffet breakfast in the restaurant next door was OK, but not up to the standard of other hotels in this price range. I was irritated by the receptionist's insistence on payment in cash for the room in advance of checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Thandiwe
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Honigmond. The restaurant is fabulous and very reasonable. The staff are helpful and courteous. The rooms are very pretty, and the bathrooms just perfect. My only complaint is that the hotel had absolutely no standard pillows, only oversized and slightly soft European pillows, which I didn't find as comfortable. I would certainly go back again. Internet was a bit spotty, but free.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OldOztravellers
Reviews.Content: We will go back to Berlin and we will stay at Honigmond Hotel when we do. The location is terrific. Close to all kinds of transport and easy walking distance to most of the sights. The rooms are good, clean and well equiped. The bathrooms are seriously good. The breakfast is a feast. The staff is efficient and helpful. The restaurant is quite good but there are lots of cheap eats in Torstrasse (100 meters away) and better places if you cross Torstrasse and head down Tucholskystrasse towards Oranienburger Strasse. Honigmond is great value!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: meloruss96
Reviews.Content: Honigmond Hotel is fantastic, beautiful, calm, very great price/quality rate. People are very nice and helpful. 2 or 3 subway stops from Brandenburger Tor. We booked 8 rooms for our wedding in Berlin, all family members enjoyed their stay in Honigmond Hotel. They have double rooms and apartments which is convenient for families. On our wedding night, the hotel offered us a bottle of Sekt and spread rose petals on the floor and the bed, it was very nice. We also enjoyed the restaurant, where we took the breakfasts and the first diner. Next time we go to Berlin, we'll definitely stay in Honigmond Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, modern and a bit quirky in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MildredCambridge
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked an apartment in the Honigmond Hotel for my birthday as a suprise. It was lovely, relaxing, quite romantic and very quiet given its location, which is excellent. The decor is modern with some quirky touches which distinguishes it from any chains. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the buffet breakers had plenty of choice and was as substantial as one wanted. Berlin was wonderful albeit with a very small sprinkling of rudness from some officials but don't let that put you off going to this amazing city. We got o lot of value form our 25 euro travel cards ( make sure you validate tickets before you travel) which give you a reduction into some attractions. The puplic transport system is excellent, clean and we felt pretty safe using it at night too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicheleD79
Reviews.Content: My sister and her boyfriend live in Berlin and booked this hotel for our parents when we came to visit them (I stayed at their place). They booked the Honigmond because it looked lovely when they had passed there once and it was just 2 streets away from their home. My parents are used to very high standard hotels and service and were absolutely very satisfied with this hotel. The location is superb, in a very quiet street just 5 minutes walking from the galleries and little shops of Mitte and not even 5 min walking from the Nordbahnhof metro station. The reception area is just lovely, with leather chairs, tables with travel guides and newspapers, a bowl full of lovely chocolates, chocolates at the reception, a free internet pc, etc. The staff is very friendly and helpful as well. Rooms are just adorable, with four-poster beds, charming decoration and ceiling ornaments, and an impeccable bathroom. Only downside perhaps is that the rooms are not extremely big and there was no place to put the suitcase on. Breakfast is excellent and plentyful, including some brunch items. The 3 of us went to have breakfast with my parents, and it was just 8,50€ each + drinks. One downside: no fresh orange juice. All in all a great experience !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickwebb1
Reviews.Content: - Beautiful hotel full of antiques - Fantastic room (4 poster bed!) - each room is unique - Happy to do a special breakfast for us on the morning of the Berlin marathon - Reception staff very friendly - Excellent Restaurant - Good value

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: IrelandWanderlust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for exploring Berlin. Located on a quiet residential street in Mitte, it is just 2 blocks from restaurants, cafes and quirky shops (art galleries, clothes designers, retro furniture) and another couple of minutes from the Museum Island and Unter den Linden. The reception is cosy and welcoming ('though a little overheated for our taste). There are 2 extremely comfortable seating areas with an honesty bar and furnished with guidebooks, international newspapers and coffee table books/magazines about german style and design. The staff are helpful but not intrusive. Everyone (reception, cleaners, waiting staff at breakfast) has a cheerful 'Guten Tag' and 'Tschuss'. We booked an apartment which was €200 per night including breakfast. It (A3) was to the rear of the hotel overlooking the courtyard. The lift only serves the ground, 1st and 2nd floors. We were on the 3rd and had to climb a further flight of stairs. Anyone with mobility problems (or who doesn't feel like climbing) should make sure their room is accessible. There was no porter. The main room was spacious and well furnished having sufficient storage etc. The bed end was a bit dark - but we were out all day and it meant that the room was blacked out at night for better sleeping. It was also unseasonably warm during our stay and the room was lovely and cool. The bed was large and really comfortable - as often found on the continent, it had 2 separate mattresses and duvets. The bathroom was fully tiled and had a bath and shower. It was clean and definitely big enough for 2 people to use at once. Shower/Bath gel was provided but nothing else. The kitchen was equipped with a hob, an oven, fridge-freezer etc. but no washing up liquid or basic condiments etc. A welcome basket would have been pleasant; those items should be automatically provided. That would sum up our only quibble - there was an extra touch that was missing in some areas even though it was provided in others. The breakfast was gargantuan. Served in the Honigmond restaurant downstairs till 11am, the buffet tables were replenished constantly. Cereal, breads, cheese, eggs, salads, ham, smoked fish, fruits, yoghurts......the list goes on. Delicious and enough to keep you going till mid afternoon cake! Try the restaurant for dinner - the Klopsche (meatballs in caper sauce) are well worth it. Be warned though: the portions are really enormous and sharing one three-course meal between 2 would do most people! It is excellent value but eating out in Berlin is generally. All in all, a definite hit. We liked it (and Berlin!) so much that we stayed an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AngloTexan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honigmond for a few days in April while we explored Berlin. Good location within walking distance of a bunch of the sights and with a number of public transport options close by. Great room, spacious and clean, cool decor! The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was awesome: the best breakfast / brunch buffet I have come across so far! We did not have dinner in the hotel restaurant as there a few good restaurants close to the hotel (Sarah Weiner, the Restaurant in the Brechthaus). Can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “East Berlin Beauty”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeB
Reviews.Content: The Honigmond ("honey moon" in literally translated German) Hotel in Berlin Mitte is a jewel. Its great location, great staff, great rooms and a fabulous restaurant make a stay at the Honigmond a memorable one. The included breakfast is extensive enough to fill you up 'til dinner. The rooms are individually decorated -- check out several of them before you choose because a few (not many) share a bath. (None of the rooms, as far as I could tell, have phones in them.) But the bathrooms are spotless and modern, the flat screen TV's are perfect for watching CNN, and in the comfortable lobby a computer provides free Internet access for all guests. The Honigmond is within easy walking distance to U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations and to many Strassenbahn (streetcar) and bus lines, AND within walking distance to a large group of outstanding restaurants AND within walking distance to the best of Berlin's cutting edge art galleries. From the hotel it's a short cab ride to Tegel, still Berlin's primary airport. I'd bed down again at the Honigmond in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot to stay..”
Reviews.Author: cuckoosnest
Reviews.Content: Honigmond was recommended to us by a professor who travels to Berlin frequently. We found it a little more expensive than a regular 'chain' hotel, but it was worth it at the end of the day for the nice touches and character of the rooms and public areas. The breakfast was included, served in the Honigmond restaurant and it was fantastic. We also ate dinner in the restaurant one night, and the food was great, although we subsequently found other places slightly cheaper. There is free internet access, which is great for keeping up to date, and daily papers are available in the foyer area (with its leather chairs) and in the restaurant. The bathrooms and the rooms were spotless and modern. The only quibble we had was with the noise from the wooden floored hallways, as you can hear suitcases and clip-clop of people leaving first thing in the morning. There's really not anything to be done about that, serves us right for being lazy and sleeping the day away! Overall, a very stylish yet comfortable place that we'd recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended +++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Honigmond in July 2004. The service was excellent, the garden beautiful, the breakfasts lovely and it is situated perfectly for discovering the Mitte district. I would advise asking for a room with a view of the garden though, as mine didn't and that would have made it a perfect 5 star review.
